dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4453486R] FW: Copyright infringement
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Thursday, June 07, 2007 9:47 AM To: DMCA Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4453486R] FW: Copyright infringement ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. FW: Copyright infringement Added by system at Thursday, Jun 7 2007 02:43 pm X-MailFrom: ASteinecke@randomhouse.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Thu Jun 7 14:43:37 2007 Received: (qmail 27342 invoked by alias); 7 Jun 2007 19:43:37 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 27305 invoked from network); 7 Jun 2007 19:43:32 -0000 Received: from spooling.theplanet.com (69.56.141.4) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 7 Jun 2007 19:43:32 -0000 Return-path: Delivery-date: Thu, 07 Jun 2007 14:43:32 -0500 Received: from [172.16.220.10] (helo=DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL) by spooling.theplanet.com (envelope-from ASteinecke@randomhouse.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1HwNtL-0001q8-Th for abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net; Thu, 7 Jun 2007 14:43:03 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from ASteinecke@randomhouse.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HwNss-0003mP-Tv for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 07 Jun 2007 14:43:03 -0500 Received: from ares.randomhouse.com ([170.171.1.201]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from ASteinecke@randomhouse.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1HwNsp-000EQn-De for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 07 Jun 2007 14:42:59 -0500 Received: from NYXSRV-4.us.randomhouse.com ([10.105.2.63]) by ares.randomhouse.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(5.0.2195.6713); Thu, 7 Jun 2007 15:42:57 -0400 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C7A93C.0C5D5949" Subject: FW: Copyright infringement Date: Thu, 7 Jun 2007 15:42:57 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Copyright infringement Thread-Index: AceoiLSXCcExF+8mSQyeExfrTQLhWgAAF5rAACygWaA= X-Priority: 1 Priority: Urgent Importance: high From: "Steinecke, Anke" To: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 07 Jun 2007 19:42:57.0660 (UTC) FILETIME=[0C862BC0:01C7A93C] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear Sir/Madam: it has come to our attention that the website davron.ru is registered through your company. The site is committing willful copyright infringement (please see details below) and has not responded to our cease and desist demand. Please promptly have the site remove the infringing content and infrom us that our demand has eben complied with. Sincerely , ........................................................................ ..... ............ Anke E. Steinecke Vice President, Associate General Counsel Random House, Inc. 1745 Broadway New York, NY 10019 Tel. 212-782-9861 Fax: 212-782-8879 e-mail: asteinecke@randomhouse.com _____________________________________________ From: Steinecke, Anke Sent: Wednesday, June 06, 2007 6:22 PM To: 'davron@gmail.com' Subject: FW: Copyright infringement Davron: I am the attorney for the Knopf Publishing Group, a division of Random House, Inc. It has come to our attention that you are making President Clinton's "My Life" available on your website at http://davron.ru/extra/files/pdf/Bill_Clinton_-_My_Life.pdf. Neither Random House nor President Clinton has granted you a license to publish this work online. Accordingly, your publication of the unauthorized edition of the work constitutes willful infringement of copyright and violates the exclusive publishing rights granted to Random House. Random House demands that you immediately (i) cease publishing any editions of President Clinton's "My Life" and (ii) destroy all electronic files of the work that you have created and/or archived. This letter is without prejudice to Random House's and President Clinton's rights and remedies which are expressly reserved. Your failure to promptly comply with the demands of this letter may result in Random House taking legal action to enforce its copyrights and may include, without limitation, a demand for injunctive relief, statutory damages in an amount up to $150,000 per infringement, attorneys' fees and expenses. I would appreciate your prompt response to this letter. Very truly yours, ........................................................................ ..... ............ Anke E. Steinecke Vice President, Associate General Counsel Random House, Inc. 1745 Broadway New York, NY 10019 Tel. 212-782-9861 Fax: 212-782-8879 e-mail: asteinecke@randomhouse.com ........................................................................ ..... ............ Anke E. Steinecke Vice President, Associate General Counsel Random House, Inc. 1745 Broadway New York, NY 10019 Tel. 212-782-9861 Fax: 212-782-8879 e-mail: asteinecke@randomhouse.com MIME element (text/html) FW: Copyright infringement

Dear Sir/Madam: it has come to our attention that the website davron.ru is registered through your company. The site is committing willful copyright infringement (please see details below) and has not responded to our cease and desist demand. Please promptly have the site remove the infringing content and infrom us that our demand has eben complied with. 

Sincerely ,

    

........................................................... ..............................
Anke E. Steinecke
Vice President, Associate General Counsel
Random House, Inc.

_____________________________________________
From: Steinecke, Anke
Sent: Wednesday, June 06, 2007 6:22 PM
To: 'davron@gmail.com'
Subject: FW: Copyright infringement

Davron:

        I am the attorney for the Knopf Publishing Group, a division of Random House, Inc.  It has come to our attention that you are making President Clinton’s “My Life” available on your website at http://davron.ru/extra/files/pdf/Bill_Clinton_-_My_Life.pdf.  Neither Random House nor President Clinton has granted you a license to publish this work online.  Accordingly, your publication of the unauthorized edition of the work constitutes willful infring! ement of copyright and violates the exclusive publishing rights granted to Random House.

 

        Random House demands that you immediately (i) cease publishing any editions of President Clinton’s “My Life” and  (ii) destroy all electronic files of the work that you have created and/or archived.

         This letter is without prejudice to Random House’s and President Clinton’s rights and remedies which are expressly reserved.  Your failure to promptly comply with the demands of this letter may result in Random House taking legal action to enforce its copyrights and may include, without limitation, a demand for injunctive relief, statutory damages in an amount up to $150,000 per infringement, attorneys’ fees and expenses.

        I would appreciate your prompt response to this letter.

                                        Very truly yours,



........................................................... ..............................
Anke E. Steinecke
Vice President, Associate General Counsel
Random House, Inc.
1745 Broadway
New York, NY 10019
Tel. 212-782-9861
Fax: 212-782-8879
e-mail: asteinecke@randomhouse.com

Anke E. Steinecke
